text: I'll make this brief.  The service was horrible; we had to wait ten minutes in an empty restaurant.  My husband finally had to go to the bar side to get anyone to wait on us.  Shrimp scampi appetizer had five TINY shrimp, and the garlic toast was burned.  We had to wait to get silverware and napkins.  Our food came out, and my burger was well done when I ordered it medium rare.  She didn't bring the ketchup until our meal was finished.  Even with the Restaurant.com savings, we'll never return again.

The menu looks good, we had a coupon and were excited to try this place. We walked in and the bartender had no greeting and we had to ask where to sit? The bartender comes to us and asks is everyone over 21 years old.  Apparently they changed the restaurant age limit to 21 recently.  The website should be updated.  We were ready to spend over $100 with a huge party and ended up leaving.

my daughter & I tried it for the first time because we had a coupon. VERY pleasantly surprised! Cute place! Waitress named Maria was so great! Very attentive, nice, suggested her faves. Prices were more than reasonable (my vodka cran was only $3.50!), service was awesome & atmosphere was great! Will def be back!! loved it!!

Got a 2-fer coupon so we decided use it for steak dinners. After 15 minutes, I had to fetch the bartender for the menus. He apologized that no one was handling the dining area and he was slammed at the bar. 

With the service lacking, we were quite surprised that our food was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Our steaks were accompanied with a baked potato and a side of veggies.  

The bartender did the best he could.  I would definately go back.

One of my favorite hang outs. The food I've had is always tasty.. my favorites are the tuna melt on rye, the chicken wings, and the Cobb salad which they put grilled chicken on if you ask. The bartenders are awesome and so is the server.

I was there on Monday August 22nd around 1 am. Sitting at the bar with a friend when from the corner of my eye I saw something move, didn't think anything of it so I didn't look. Then I saw something again, and I saw kid you not, a RAT!!!!! It then darted behind one of the cabinets/some sort of shelf. I was thinking about ordering food as well but I was disgusted. All I ordered was a corona that I barely started drinking. So I was not intoxicated or any of that where I could of just been seeing things. I told the bartender what I saw and all he said was, "idk I just started working here"! And kept on doing what he was doing. I paid our bill and we left. My first time and last time that I will ever go there!!!!!

I've eaten here plenty of times and I can honestly say that I love the food! The hamburgers are always good! The fries....THE FRIES!!! SOOO GOOD! Chicken fingers are good too! The sweet potatoe tots are really, really good! I always go during the day so not to sure if it's a different crew at night.

The only thing preventing it from 5 stars is that if you want prompt service, you have to either sit in the bar area or let the person know that you are in the regular dining area or else you could be waiting for awhile until someone comes and checks that area at first.
Great place came here to watch a game awesome service the food was great I had the bacon cheeseburger, overall staff great will be coming back soon

First of all let me say i was recommended this place because they have the best ranch in town. Ok let me let you know its hidden valley or generic brand. I ordered a mushroom Swiss burger witha veggie patty. It came as a plain veggie burger. I sent it back and they said theyd bring it right back. I asked for it all to be remade because i hate eating reheated food. It returned and the server told me that it had been remade. Ok so the patty before i sent it back i had picked some parts out. It returned and claimed
To be freshly made. NO. it was reheated. Because it was hot in the inside and hard on the outside how food gets when its nuked. And had the parts is picked out on it it was the se patty. Altogether good suckeddddd.  I will never return and neither will the other 5 people i came with. 

Plus we all ordered together. Mine came out when everyone was almost done eating. And i had to send
It back. If you want good bar food DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!!

I went to Bomas this morning with my wife for breakfast and the service was terrible.  It took over 30 minutes to get our breakfast.  The food was ok.  Half of my wife steak was dry and my omelet was good.  I don't see us going back which is too bad because it is close to the house.

What a great happy hour!

I've passed this place a ton of times but finally decided to stop in a see.

The decor sorta feels like a living room, which is a little strange, but it was comfortable so it works. We saw the happy hour appetizer menu and with everything $5, decided to pick three.

Pretzel bites with cheese - SOOOOO GOOD. That cheese is out of this world. 
Artichoke dip - Definitely not like any I had had before but it was really good as well. It also comes with chips and pita bread so it's nice to have a choice.
Chicken Skewers with Peanut Sauce - Pretty simple but had a little kick. Good as well!

The waiter was a nice guy and overall, while the set up of the place is a little different the food and service was great. Next time we want to try the nachos!

THAT CHEESE SAUCE. OH, THAT CHEESE SAUCE!!!!! Amen.

Went here to grab some bar food with a couple of buddies. Food was just terrible. How does one mess up bar food? I dont know but they managed to. On a side note they always tend to have hilarious bar signs outside, my favorite being "the liver is evil, it must be punished. 1$ beer" 2 stars for historical signs.

We continue to be pleased with the quality of the food at Bomas.  Ordered a greek salad with broiled salmon (not on the menu) and it was delicious the salmon was cooked perfectly and so was my husbands steak.  I hope the put a greek salad with a protein option on the menu.  We will be back
Awesome bar good people Erin ,Katie and John are all great.luv this place
Great service, the chicken taquitos were awesome, the philly steak sandwich, sweet potato tots all were very good. I will for sure be back!

Went to Bomas after reading reviews of good Video Poker with progressives. Nice clean, quiet establishment with decent selection of draft beer (and full bar). Different deals going on all the time. The day I was there it was $2-200 scratch off cards for hitting 4oak. Cashed out after hitting AAAA.

A couple weeks ago we were seated next to a wall, one of the kids dropped something under the table and found some Rat droppings under  there. Will never go again, won't miss it because the service and food have gone down hill since our last visit. Disgusting!

You can't miss this place either you are coming from 215 fwy or Blue Diamond blvd... It is in ISLAND FLAVOR's plaza, a big sign of BOMAS on the building!

This place has two part: bar and restaurant, but both of them are quiet (maybe because I always check-in at lunch time).

I like their wraps... 
I like their breakfast menu...
I like their service, especially with the guy ( I'll ask his name next time ^^ )

I forgot the couple meals I had, but I'll update all the missing information soon! 

However, this is very nice place to hang out with co-workers!

Had a restaurant.com certificate. Service was great! We had the herb crusted salmon and chicken piccata. Both meals were excellent! I have been trying salmon in a lot of restaurants. Most of the time I find the salmon dry but not at Bomas. Will eat here again!
Not my favorite. Food tasted frozen and the place was dirty. Would have been great for drinks only....skip the food

The worst service ever. Went for diner Saturday night party of four. At 7pm, the grill was closed and only 3 people at the bar. We waited anyway but the food was poor quality and bad. The sandwiches had less meat than a Subway and the pasta dishes were poor. If your a vegan and like to overpay for what you get, this is the place. The waitress Maria C was not attentive and spent more time with two people playing pool. When it was brought to here attention that it was so little meat on the Philly cheese steak and didn't offer a remedy she said she should talk to here supervisor who would be in tomorrow. The worst in LV.

Lets just start by saying I will never recommend this place. I went today with my girl since we had a coupon from the Valupak and figured we can try something new. We get there and sit down and it took almost 10 minutes before our waitress came to greet us. She asked first for our drink order and I asked for Iced Tea, she told me they were out and she only had an hour left on her shift so she didn't want to make any. But yet the table across from us they were all enjoying glasses of Iced tea. Then I decided to try their NY Strip and shrimp special which is supposed to come with a baked potato, but she once again said they were out of baked potatoes but again another table next to me which came in after received a baked potato with their meal, weird right??? Another thing was the table next to us asked her for tarter sauce, and she replied that they didn't have tarter sauce since they didn't serve fish on the menu. The customer then asked if they didn't have fish then why was there a fish sandwhich, BBQ Salmon, and fried Tilapia on the menu. She then replied saying that ya its on the menu but they never sell it so never make tarter sauce for it. What kind of answer is this right? Obviously we were at a bar so we both weren't expecting a great meal, and big surprise... the food quality was poor. The corn on the cob was nasty and over boiled, and nothing really had flavor. Lastly when it came to paying, we tried to use the coupon we received which was buy one meal get one free. She told us since I ordered the daily special they can't honor the coupon even though my girlfriends meal cost more. But if I would of picked a meal that was on the regular menu that cost more then it would of been free. I was like Really? They would rather give me a free $12 meal versus an $8 meal.  I'm no mathmetician but they should be happy I wanted the cheaper meal free. So like a fellow reviewer said, the coupons must be a scam since they wouldn't honor ours either.  So in a nut shell.... The service was awful and the food wasn't worth the money.   I hope that anyone who reads this doesn't waste their time trying this place as far as the restaurant side goes.

Small sinple menu. But i like the space and atmosphere. The bartender was alil lazy. But it was all good. He ended up being nice and comped our drinks for playing. It has pool tables and a lot of tvs to watch games.

Great service today! I called ahead to pickup a food order and Tracy was super nice! I went to pick it up and while waiting Tracy gave me a cup of coffee to go, no extra charge. Upon getting the food home, it was piping hot and delicious. We even had ranch, jelly, ketchup, extra napkins, etc. thank you for making my short experience worthwhile!

I just checked this bar out after moving to Mountain's Edge.  It's a small local bar with a nice clean environment.  Both bartenders I have met have been super cool, Dave and Eric (both Graveyard bartenders) are friendly and make you feel right at home.  I've hit 5 spots two nights in a row, so it's nice knowing their machines pay frequently...plus their food is pretty good!  Great local spot, will definitely be back again!

Since we had a Restaurant.com gift certificate, we headed here the other day for a late lunch. Now this place seemed totally fine for drinking, but this review is based on the food.

The service was ok, though very slow. And the food just seemed to take way too long to come out. 

We started off with the appetizer combo platter. It definitely all seemed like it was something that was just popped in the microwave. The wings were decent. The jalapeno spinach dip was actually pretty tasty. Everything else was a fail.

For entrees, we had the BBQ beef sandwich and the BBQ burger. The sandwich was ok. Not too bad on flavor. And I even enjoyed the pasta salad that I chose as the side. The burger, however, was barely edible and the fries were left almost completely untouched.

Now, there could be other menu items that are great. The BBQ flavors were decent enough that I would try other BBQ menu items. And the breakfast part of the menu did have some tasty sounding things. But based on this one experience and the food we had, there's no way I can give it more than 2 stars.

We work near this restaurant/bar! We have been here 4 times since discovering this gem. The wait staff is awesome and the chef delivers the food to the table and always checks on our meals! The food is the best in the area! I would highly recommend this place!
Great bartenders, fun little local spot for anyone to hang out at! The food is awesome too. Definitely try their nachos and the Thai chicken salad... my faves!!!!

Had a restaurant.com coupon and they indicated we couldn't use it for to go food. The coupon does NOT read this way. AWFUL service.  Bartender used foul language with guests.  Food OK.  Will never return.  BAD BAD BAD.
Love this place!   Great bartenders and atmosphere.   The food is delicious as well!  Definitely a place to stop into and enjoy!

Our server was extremely attentive and friendly. The chef came out and said a few words to us. There were no other patrons in the restaurant but the bar was full. Our food was delicious. We went there with a restaurant.com gift cert.

I really, REALLY wanted this place to be better. I have a feeling I got it on an off day.

I've passed by Bomas for over a year now; it's so close to my house and I finally went in for breakfast today. I'm a huge fan of the cracked egg, but I wanted something fast and close to home since I was starving.

I ordered eggs over easy with bacon, sausage patties, sourdough toast. Bacon was crispy, sausage was fine, toast is toast... the eggs were really runny.

It looked good coming out, the service was excellent, but my dish was cooked improperly. I was so disappointed in the food. I'm definitely going to try it again, though, because I actually like the bar and the ambiance.

Look for an update in the next few days from me!

One of my favorite neighborhood bars in the south west. John & Jackie the bartenders are always amazing. affordable drink prices and really good food you cant go wrong with this place. food wise- try the Chicken Avocado sandwich. chicken, avocado, house dressing in a Parmesan sourdough bread its sooo yummy!
I got food poisoning a few days ago from the Lasagna. I'm just now recovering. I think I should get my money back!

My daughter and I went for a spur of the moment breakfast at Bomas. I can't tell you how good the bar is, it was breakfast. I can tell you that the bar and restaurant are separate. We arrived at around 10 am. There was no one in the restaurant side. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated. We decided to try this restaurant because it was close to Blue Diamond Highway, close to where my daughter lives. Our server, Tammie, was very pleasant for the time of morning. I received fresh brewed coffee. My daughter requested two glasses of water. She got both and a pitcher. My coffee never went empty. I had the steak and egg special which included a 6 to 8 ounce steak, two eggs, hash browns, and toast. $4.99!!! Daughter ordered the Ham and Eggs special which was the same as mine except her ham steak was almost as thick as my beef steak. $3.95!! My steak was tender and delicious. Her ham was tender and flavorful. Tammie was attentive and quick to deliver our order and pick up our plates. Overall a fantastic experience at a McDonalds price :~) If you're looking for an inexpensive breakfast, try Bamas!

This is a nice place to meet friends.  It's very clean and modern. Bartenders are friendly and I've never been disappointed with the food or service.  I like that there's a jukebox that customers can operate.  Also, I've had some pretty good luck with machines there.

Where do I even begin with this nightmare of an experience? My wife and I like to try new places so we use various sites like yelp and restaurants.com to get reviews and deals in places we don't usually eat at. I checked restaurants.com and saw a deal close to the house for this place...I've driven passed bomas about 900 times and never even gave it a thought. It's always seemed like a crappy neighborhood bar and there's never anyone there. I said why not, it's probably slow and I can get in and out. I called and tried to order off what I thought was their menu...it was linked to their website and restaurants.com so I didn't think anything of it. The lady in the phone said everything I tried to order was on their old menu and they didn't have it anymore. I told her id look again and call back. I found another menu link on their website, called back, and gave it another chance. This time yet again they didn't carry those items again...it was only a sampler and a sandwich!! And they didn't have it. So I just ordered the most basic bar food I could think of, fingers and a steak sandwich. She told me they don't make a steak sandwich anymore, but she can ask the kitchen. She said it would be ready in 15 mins. I get there and there's maybe 8 cars there...it's Friday night at 8pm. There's people dealing drug's in the parking lot.. this is by Rhoads ranch btw...so that has to tell you how much of a drag this place is. When you walk in there's a restaurant side and a bar side. I sit in the restaurant side since I ordered food and there's only 5 people there at two tables. I waited for 10 mins before someone came out of the back to tell me they couldn't help me and I had to go to the bar. I go to the bar and waited for 10 mins until the bartender came and asked me what I wanted ..there were only 4 people there! I said in here for a pick up..she told me ok and had the guy from the restaurant side bring over my food. She comes over with the bill and I hand her my card and the certificate..she tells me that I can't use it for take out. Now just to make this clear, I read the certificate all the way through including the fine print and it does not say that anywhere in there. I didn't argue because I'm not a crazy cheap bastard....plus I can just exchange it on the site I got out from which is a great feature. I paid and left...I even tipped. Now the moral to my story is..this is las Vegas, I live in the south west ..there are about 150 places around my house I would gladly of paid full price for..this crappy little bar with poor customer service and even worse food is not one of them...and I would urge you not to as well.  The steak sandwich was gross and was over cooked beef slapped on a roll. The chips were little grease bowls and the sweet potato tots were soggy. I will give credit where it's due though..if you do deal with this crappy little bar try the chicken fingers. They were the only saving grace.

tonight at 3am, we were the only ones here & ordered only food. Waited over 35 minutes for the bartender to tell me that the COOK can't figure out how to make my taco salad!! Bartender kept checking in the kitchen & told me the guy should've been fired a long time ago. I ordered a salad and it couldn't be prepared at all! So then I ordered chicken quesadillas..going on an HOUR of no food still....I feel like going in the kitchen and asking the cook if he is incompetent! So ridiculous- NEVER AGAIN WILL I COME HERE! Unbelievable experience for being the only two in this place ordering food!! SMH.. I'm ready to walk out and go through a drive thru. If a manager sees this, I hope that idiot cook is fired, I won't bring an business here as log as that clown is in the kitchen. SO RIDICULOUS!
Food is not that good. I had pulled pork and brisket.

I think I came in here with the right expectation. I wanted a burger, some kind of pub appetizer, and a few beers, and that's exactly what I got. service, good. beer, good. burgers, great! and all for a fair price. 

my bf and I both ordered the Bacon Avocado Burger, and I asked for the burger cooked well done. it showed up looking tasty, charred on the outside and juicy on the inside. bacon on the burger was crisp, and the avocado was fresh and tasty. 

I had the sweet potato tots, and bf had the fries, I ate all mine and cleaned his leftovers. they were both SO good, just about the perfect sides for our burgers. 

we also ordered the pretzels, and while the cheese sauce was thin, it was packed with flavor. 

we sat on the bar side, wasn't too smoky and we could vape at the bar. very friendly!! will go back when I'm craving a burger again.

What a great little bar!  

Very updated design-wise (felt contemporary, yet comfortable) with a good variety of food stuffs on their menu.  I went with the crispy chicken salad and I loved it....loads of spinach, perfect crispy chicken (not just a cut up chicken tender) and a delicious dressing ( come to find out they make all of their dressings in house!).  Some better than average Pinot's on their list too.  You can tell by taste and quality that someone thought hard about the food in this place and wanted to make this a highlight to an otherwise gaming bar.  

My husband and I loved this local gem and we will absolutely be back.
Sunday morning breakfast special.  They have real hashbrown potatoes.  Try them,Alyson is a fantastic waitress and there is not a wait.
This place is awful, just awful. Couldn't get a drink order right for the entire group, used a half shot of liquor for mixed drinks, and the food was terrible.

I have been coming here to watch football cause it's the only bar around my house that has the nfl ticket and the morning bartender on Sunday is pretty awesome, however last night I came the swing shift bartender refused to put the sound on for the game stating "it's not an important game" keep in mind there was 3 or 4 people plus my group to watch the game. This isn't the first time I have problems with the swing bartenders in this place. I hate when all a bar cares about are the gamblers and treat everyone else like second class costumer!!!!! So if you are not gonna gamble A LOT don't bother going to Bomas.

Decent food amazing service! Maria is such a nice server! So polite and attentive!

The bartender... Big guy with a beard? Was also amazing! Came by to top-off my martini with the leftovers.

The food is ok, bar food nothing unusually different. Same thing with the drinks. The angry snake bite? Was ok, enjoyed the sour peach martini though.
May go back, but as I said average food, great service... Thank you Maria!!!

I attended an event here and was pleasantly surprised by this little bar. The service was excellent, and considering that the event was quite a large number of people, the staff managed to keep everyone's drinks full and get food out at a very reasonable pace.
I had chicken fingers (hot) and french fries, very good, and excellent ranch dressing. If you eat hot chicken fingers with ranch dressing like me, you know that good ranch is key. 
This place isn't close to my house so I don't see myself just stopping in, but if I am in the neighborhood, I will definitely come back.

Recently I've visited Bomas late night after playing poker.  They have a new graveyard chef, Roxy.  While the menu is mostly standard bar fair, she puts a nice fresh spin on the preparation.  Food is hot and fresh and cooked nicely.  Some of my favorites are Chicken Picata, Taquitos, Chicken Caesar wrap, and Nachos. If you're out and about late, stop in for a bite and a drink.   The bar machines pay  good and the drinks are good too.  The only reason I didn't vote 5 stars is I don't love their sweet and sour bar mix so that means I have to choose drinks without that ingredient.  My husband has happy hour beer here and a late afternoon snack. He loves the ease of access and all the sports showing on TV.  If you haven't tried this place in a while, give it a chance.  Drink Eat and be happy.  It has a great lounging area and pool tables too.  Bomas is that sleeper bar where you can always get a good seat and nice bite to eat!

The service is definitely spotty.  Depending on the bartender (I have been here 4 or 5 times) it is either really good or really bad.   I do have a food review, however:

$5.95 Steak Special- This is a monthly special that seems to not expire.  For a very reasonable price you get a very poor cut of meat (appx 6 oz), but it is wonderfully seasoned.  I opted for the Mashed Potatoes and Gravy and it also included a healthy portion of brocolli, carrots, and squash.  Excellent meal for the price.  I was quite impressed.

My better half had a Veggie Sandwich and she complimented it more than once.  She made it clear that she would definitely order it again, so a decent option for the more health conscious.

The bar rather clean, has a nice seating area for groups...  I will give them more business in the future.

Came here for the first time for a business lunch. HORRIBLE service. Waited 15 minutes to be greeted or acknowledged. I even called while sitting in the restaurant area just to double check they were open.  After taking our drink order and app order we didn't see her again for another 15 minutes!  Both times she came back to our table someone from the restaurant went and got her.  Food was ok but not great. They were super lazy and put the toothpick with the plastic stuff on it upside down in my sandwich so I had blue plastic pieces in my food.  The pretzel bites appetizer was pretty yummy though.  Not a place I will be back to.  So disappointed!

We came in here on a Sunday and discovered that it had been completely remodeled! It looks completely different and the bar opens up to the dining room which now has a pool table. It was pretty empty and we sat right away. The bartender was also the server and she was awesome. We ordered mimosas. I think they were $5 or something crazy cheap. I ordered the steak and eggs and bf ordered a chicken wrap. Both meals were delicious!  The sweet potato tots are sooo good. The steak with my breakfast was sooo good. My bf's wrap was soooo good! Lol. Everything was just really good and it was so nice to get great service.

Supporting our local businesses requires some effort and Bomas is in the area.  It's early evening on a Sunday and there's probably one other party dining there when we arrive.

I go with the Chicken Piccata "Chicken breast sauteed with white wine, garlic, lemon juice, capers and fresh mushrooms.  Served with roasted red potatoes and vegetables." for $14.95.  I was actually surprised with how tasty my chicken was, and for it being the breast part, it wasn't dry at all.  My potatoes were quite the red ones that were advertised, but it served it's purpose.

The Big F ordered the Ribeye Steak "A 14 oz. steak with cracked black pepper and garlic then broiled to your specifications, served with baked potato and vegetables." for $22.95.  It was actually too big for him and he had leftovers! 

Our dinners also came with soup or salad.  Soup of the day was cream of mushroom and it was a tasty soup alright.  Lots of cream in it and I almost regretted that I chose the salad instead.  I had requested for the dressing on the side, but it ended up on top.  The vinaigrette was pretty tasty over my salad though.  The Caesars salad is an option too.

Service was standard.  Our waitress looked like she may have been handling something else other than the two tables because she looked overworked.  

Overall, a simple meal in a simple place.  Nothing special, but it worked for us.  

3.5 stars

(Pics are posted!)

Just went in with the Hubs for Happy Hour. Had a couple of Blue Moons and nachos. Blue Moons, great, nachos not so great. This is a great local bar but the food for years has been subpar at best! Not sure what's going on in the back of the house but the need to work on that part and I think they would have potential to be a solid neighborhood bar!

If you want a truly terrible takeout experience, order from Bomas. We ordered a few simple sandwiches from the menu, had a few simple requests (hold the mayo, hold the onions, mushrooms etc). Every single food item was wrong. Cup of chilli was hotdog chilli quality, cold and loaded with raw red onions, two of the sandwiches had mayo and onions, neither sandwich listed mayo as an ingredient on the menu, but NEVERTHELESS we made sure to let them know that we don't want mayo or onions on ANYTHING. 

There was mayo and onions on EVERYTHING and awful little rubber mushrooms on the dog food quality steak. The soup was also cold and quite boring.

On top of that, this bar is an absolute dump, the staff is completely disinterested in everything, and the bar is loaded up with career drunks and gambling addicts who stare daggers at every unfortunate female who happens to come through the doors, like a bunch of date-rape predators.

Do yourself a favor and go literally anywhere else. If I could give 0/5 Stars I certainly would.

The fries weren't the worst ever.

"A-ok" for me considering it was a spur of the moment "what's open at midnight?" food grab (with restaurant.com offer)

What's weird in this town is that a couple of bars that actually had great food went out of business and those that serve the typical burgers and appetizers maintain a steady clientele, go figure.

Anyway, I ordered the ribeye steak medium rare, it came out medium well. Sweet potato tots were good, baked potato- alright.

Shrimp scampi and the angel hair pasta a little dry...I think you could go to a second rate buffet that has a live cooking station (Red Rock, Silverton) and get a better shrimp scampi over angel hair.

I guess my mistake was to go for the entrees expecting a good dinner when it's really a place to grab nachos and burgers and other finger food so I won't really burn them for it. 

Waitress was nice and service was good. Interior was clean.

Patrons here are offered a variety of cuisines- it's surprisingly great Bar Food here!  Classic Bar Food dishes, prepared into the wee hours.  Simple, yet a memorable bar amongst the chains which inundate this town.  Laid back vibe, neighborhood bar with an attentive staff.  Yes, friendly or I would not have returned as a repeat customer:)  A must order or have are the house made potato chips, every time!  I order them with a side of blue cheese- trust me;)  I'm a good soup fanatic, and here I have yet to be disappointed.  My friend always orders the nachos.  I'm not a Mexican Food fan, but I just tell you these are delicious and for that price I wonder why can't other places make them as great these!  If more places made nachos this tasty, I could be turned ha!  I do favor those chips, and other times the pretzel bites.  The shrimp pesto I've had twice and it can be addicting.  A friend and I shared the French dip and OH MY!  That's amazing. Piping hot, perfectly sliced roast beef and the Swiss was melted, and melted well that it was perfectly on all the slices of roast beef. So, I'm done typing this as I've made myself hungry...
This is a really cool sports bar. Great selection of beers and tv's all around the place. They also show the UFC fights.

I'm going to admit, we came here solely because of a restaurant.com certificate. 

This is just an ok place to catch a bite and a beer in the area, but if you stay within the confines of spending $35 bucks here (including your beer), you'll actually get away with a pretty cheap meal.

I went with my usual wings + side salad no carb meal, and the wings were nothing special.  Flavor wise they were good (but it's hard to screw up hot sauce and butter), but crunch wise they were a little soggy.  My husband's food was forgettable, so much that I forgot what he ate.  The highlight was the beer, game in huge chilled glasses and was really refreshing on a warm summer night.

With tip we paid less than $15 which for what we had was a bargain, but even at these prices with the certificate I'm not really itching to go back.

Well I went to the bar area only, on a Tuesday night.  It's a great place to go hang out after work and just relax.  Great HH specials and service is great.  The Bartender was very nice and inviting (Jacklyn I think is her name).  I recommend this location and plan to continue to go back.
